chapter.title: ToolBar Controls
chapter.para: The ToolBar class provides methods to work with and manipulate the underlying Windows toolbar dialog control which it represents. It is a concrete subclass of the dialog object and therefore has all methods of the dialog control object.

In addition to the methods of the class itself, the following methods from other classes in the ooDialog framework are needed, or are useful, when working with toolbar controls:
Instantiation:
Use the method of the object to retrieve a new ToolBar object.
Dynamic Definition:
To dynamically define a toolbar in a class, use the method.
Event Notification
To connect the notifications sent by the underlying toolbar control to a method in the Rexx dialog object use the method.

section.title: Method Table
section.para: The following table provides links to the documentation for the primary classes, methods, and attributes used in working with ToolBar objects, including the pertinent classes, and methods from other classes:

row.entry: TbButton objects define the buttons in a toolbar and are used to receive information concerning buttons in the toolbar.
Returns a ToolBar object for the control with the specified ID.
Creates a toolbar control in the dialog template of a
Connects toolbar event notifications to a method in the Rexx dialog object

section.title: newToolBar (dialog object method)
section.para:
ToolBar objects can not be instantiated by the programmer from Rexx code. Rather a ToolBar object is obtained by using the () method of the object. The syntax is:
>>-newToolBar(--id--)----------------------------><

section.title: createToolBar (UserDialog method)
section.para:
A toolbar control can be added to the dialog template for a dialog through the () method. The basic syntax is:
>>--createToolBar(-id-,--x-,--y-,--cx-,--cy-+---------+--+-----------------+--)--->< +-,-style-+ +-,-attributeName-+

section.title: connectToolBarEvent (dialog object method)
section.para:
To connect event notifications from an toolbar control use the () method of the object. The basic syntax is:
>>-connectToolBarEvent(--id--,--event--+----------------+--+--------------+--)---->< +--,-methodName--+ +-,-willReply--+

section.title: TbButton Class
section.para: A TbButton object represents a button in a . The attributes of a TbButton object contain information for a specific button in a toolbar.
